intro: Calochortus shastensis, commonly known as Shasta mariposa lily, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants known for their showy, often showy flowers. This species is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of pink to lavender-colored flowers. It typically blooms in late spring to early summer, and its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves. Calochortus shastensis is often found in meadows and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
